title: Includes member of school athletics department or physical education department on committee on special ed, requires committee to determine level of participation in programs
summary: Includes member of school athletics department or physical education department on committee on special education; requires committee to determine level of participation in school athletic programs permitted for student with a handicapping condition; directs that no eligibility requirements shall bar a student's participation in an athletic program/activity if the committee on special education determines participation is permissible.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to adding a member of the
         school athletics department or physical education department onto  the
         committee on special education, and requiring such committee to deter-
         mine  the level of participation in school athletic programs permitted
         for a student with a handicapping condition

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  4 of section 4401-a of the education law, as
    2  amended by chapter 378 of the laws  of  2007,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    4.  The  individual  evaluation  of the educational needs of a student
    5  referred to the committee on special education  shall  be  conducted  by
    6  qualified  individuals AND SHALL INCLUDE AN ASSESSMENT OF SUCH STUDENT'S
    7  ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN SCHOOL  ATHLETIC  PROGRAMS  AND/OR  ACTIVITIES
    8  SUCH  AS  PHYSICAL  EDUCATION  CLASSES OR COMPETITIVE OR NON-COMPETITIVE
    9  SPORTS, in accordance with regulations of  the  commissioner,  with  the
   10  results  of such evaluation forwarded to the committee on special educa-
   11  tion and the student's parent or person in parental relation.   NOTWITH-
   12  STANDING  ANY  OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, NO ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SHALL
   13  PRECLUDE A STUDENT'S PARTICIPATION IN SCHOOL  ATHLETIC  PROGRAMS  AND/OR
   14  ACTIVITIES  IF  SUCH  COMMITTEE  DETERMINES  THAT  SUCH PARTICIPATION IS
   15  PERMISSIBLE.

   17  by chapter 273 of the laws of 1986, is amended to read as follows:

    8    S 3. Clause (a) of subparagraph 1 of paragraph b of subdivision  1  of
    9  section 4402 of the education law, as amended by chapter 311 of the laws
   10  of  1999  and  subclause (viii) as amended by chapter 194 of the laws of

   12    (a) Such committees shall  be  composed  of  at  least  the  following
   13  members:    (i)  the  parents or persons in parental relationship to the
   14  student; (ii) one regular education teacher of the student whenever  the
   15  student is or may be participating in the regular education environment;
   16  (iii)  one special education teacher of the student, or, if appropriate,
   17  a special education provider of the student; (iv) a school psychologist;
   18  (v) a representative of such school district who is qualified to provide

   35  (x)  A  MEMBER  OF  THE SCHOOL ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT OR PHYSICAL EDUCATION
   36  DEPARTMENT; AND (XI) if appropriate, the student.
   37    S 4. Subparagraph 3 of paragraph b of subdivision 1 of section 4402 of
   38  the education law is amended by adding a  new  clause  (m)  to  read  as
   39  follows:
   40    (M)  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY  OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, THE COMMITTEE SHALL
   41  OBTAIN, REVIEW AND EVALUATE ALL RELEVANT INFORMATION PERTAINING  TO  THE
   42  ABILITY  OF  A  STUDENT  WITH A HANDICAPPING CONDITION TO PARTICIPATE IN
   43  SCHOOL ATHLETIC PROGRAMS AND/OR ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO
   44  PHYSICAL EDUCATION CLASSES AND COMPETITIVE AND  NON-COMPETITIVE  SPORTS.
   45  BASED  UPON  SUCH  REVIEW, THE COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE
   46  LEVEL OF PARTICIPATION IN SCHOOL  ATHLETIC  PROGRAMS  AND/OR  ACTIVITIES
   47  PERMITTED  FOR  A STUDENT WITH A HANDICAPPING CONDITION.  NO ELIGIBILITY
   48  REQUIREMENTS SHALL  PRECLUDE  SUCH  STUDENT'S  PARTICIPATION  IN  SCHOOL
   49  ATHLETIC  PROGRAMS  AND/OR  ACTIVITIES  IF THE COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT
   50  SUCH PARTICIPATION IS PERMISSIBLE.
   51    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that the  amend-
   52  ments  to  subdivision  4 of section 4401-a of the education law made by
   53  section one of this act shall be subject to the expiration and reversion
   54  of such section pursuant to subdivision d of section 27 of  chapter  378
   55  of  the  laws of 2007, as amended, when upon such date the provisions of
   56  section two of this act shall take effect.
